headline: Mom's Simple Dumplings
description: This recipe is for dumpling dough to be dropped on top of stew as it simmers.
name: Mom's Simple Dumplings

recipeInstructions.text: Whisk together the flour, baking powder, and salt in a mixing bowl. Cut in the shortening with a knife or pastry blender until the mixture resembles fine crumbs. Stir the milk into the flour mixture until moistened. Dough will be pretty lumpy, but be sure to not over mix it!

Drop dough by large spoonfuls onto any boiling stew. The dumplings should rest on top of vegetables and meat; it's okay if they stick out of the top a bit. Cook uncovered for 10 minutes; cover and cook another 10 minutes.

review.reviewBody: Easy to make and turns out perfect every time! I sometimes put in a bit of corn flour to give them a unique taste.
First time making dumplings and they came out wonderful.
Yum. Nice and fluffy. We thoroughly love this recipe.
This is my go-to drop dumpling recipes. I have made it many times. So easy and good that I always double the recipe.
It’s wonderful! Theres one change I made! I added 1/2 milk & 1/2 chicken broth to make the dumplings. Plus I made a double batch & always will!
Xcellent

Very easy recipe and very good. I used an XXL pot and even then, it was simmering over the rim a bit but I managed not to take the lid off for the full 15 minutes. The dumplings were perfect. Will make again for sure!
This recipe works! My family loved it. The dumplings came out perfectly.
Turned out good

The dumplings turned out great. The dumplings didn’t thicken up as much as I would have liked. My next batch I will use 2 cups of flour. 1 1/2 cups for the dumplings, with the remaining 1/2 cup to be mixed with a little butter and added in as a thickening agent. They should be great!
I love rosemary so I added that to the dry mix and a little chicken bouillon powder. Wow, the dumplings turned out perfect!
Doubled! People love it! Merci! Once again!!

So easy, and tasted great! I used butter as the shorting, and a little less salt, but other then that made as written. 
I put this one in my recipe book for using again.

Wonderful, light, tender dumplings, with just the right flavor. Of course, I use butter instead of artificial fat, but otherwise, make it just as written. Reminds me so much of my grandmother’s dumplings!
They did not turn out. I must of been doing something wrong. They had good flavor but were a lumpy flat mess.
I followed the recipe exactly as it was written. I'll know in 4 minutes how it turned out.
Very good. Im vegan- used canola oil in subsitute for milk and shortening and came out fabulous thx so much
I did butter instead. Very soft but stayed together. Simple and yummy. Thanks!
These were great!
really simple and easy. i added some herbs to mine for beef stew.
Very rich and very filling!

Just made a half-size recipe for chicken noodle soup for one. I took another reviewer's advice and cooked covered, with the soup simmering, for 10 minutes. Then I turned off the burner and left it covered for another 10 minutes. Perfect! Will make this again, very soon.
We really enjoyed this recipe. I made this as written with the exception of cutting the portions back to 4 and adding dried parsley for colour.
Very simple and tasty dumplings. I did use self rising flour and did not add anything extra. It turned out great. Will use this again.
Did not make any changes. Not what I was looking for. Will keep looking. Thanks Zen.
Perfect texture. I tried butter instead of Crisco and put it under the broiler on low for five minutes.
Best dumplings I ever ate! Even better than my mother made and hers were really good!

I make this almost every week. It's a great alternative to pasta or bread. The key is really cutting the butter into the dry ingredients. Drop these into your perfectly seasoned broth by the tablespoon. Any larger and they may not cook evenly. If you don't cut the butter properly, like some have said, the dumplings aren't very good. If you prefer herbed flavor, try adding thyme or rosemary into the dry ingredients. A pinch goes a long ways!
So simple and so yummy! I substituted self-rising flour and left out the salt and baking powder. It was great.
The dumplings are good.

I have not made this specific recipe yet. I plan to as lost mine. If your dumplings break up, try having your soup/stew simmering and not at a rolling boil. Cook the same, I do lid on for 10, then lid off for 10. * Before scooping up the dumpling dough, dip the spoon, I use a serving spoon, into the soup/stew and then scoop a spoonful of batter and gently place into soup/stew by putting spoon into soup. Then dip spoon again, and repeat. This prevents the dough from sticking to the spoon.
Good dumplings! Used cold butter instead of shortening and I added about 1/2 tsp. vinegar to the milk...it's a habit i've gotten into.

I made no changes and loved it! 
very seldom do I use recipes but this is great!
Easy to make and delicious, used these in my beef stew.
These are truly delicious, and they're just like biscuits. We have them regularly in my household. They're light and tasty. I sometimes like to add parsley, garlic, or even some cheese!

Hard to rate this recipe as is since I modified it based on my lack of shortening. I used three tablespoons of butter instead and maybe a 1/4 cup of milk (I eyeballed it as I was looking for the right consistency). I cooked them in slightly salted vegetable broth for 6-7 minutes and they came out good. Ate them with part of my turkey stew. Hubby loved them.
Pure fluffy Deliciousness! Perfect as is no reason to change a thing!
Perfect! At first, I tasted one of the dumplings and a I thought it needed seasoning but when I ate them mixed into the beef stew, they were delicious! Thank you for posting!
I love this recipe I added garlic salt Italian seasoning & parsley. My family loved it so much ask me to make it again my husband Kiss me and said was the best dumplings he ever had
Easy & quick to make and came out very tasty. I also added a bit of fresh chopped parsley. Thank you for sharing!
Very easy to make. Didn't have baking powder so I used self rising and omitted salt and baking powder. Turned out fluffy and delicious!!! My husband and kids love it!!
Wonderful recipe. I added a 1/2 teaspoon sugar to the mix and added carrots and celery to the chicken soup. This is now a staple in our home.

Just so you know....this was Great Gramma Viki's recipe from so long ago, & I've loved it all my life ( and I'm almost 70, so it's OLD!). However, a dumpling is a "gentle" thing. If you have the heat too high, or "boil" the poor thing, it WILL disintegrate. Don't have to thicken the soup anymore, but I LIVE for those dumplings!!! "Gently simmer", please! !!! 

HTH!!!

I lost my mom's recipe for dumplings and tried this....it delivered! The same melt in your mouth wonderfulness of comfort. I used the recipe as written and just added a little freshly ground black pepper at the end as a topping. I used them on creamy chicken stew. I am married to a Jamaican, and after 15 years of his hard dumplings, it was heaven to come back to these little clouds of dumplings like mom used to make! This recipe is a keeper!
I didn't like them and I wish I had seasoned them

Never tried to make chicken and dumplings before, but I found a recipe last night for a crockpot version. However it called for refrigerated premade biscuits... Which I neither had on hand, or wanted to use based on the various reviews. Found this recipe this morning while it was cooking. So happy with it! Forgot to read the number of servings so I have more dough then needed, but it's a simple recipe with cheap ingredients so I'm not too upset. I did substitute margarine for shortening simply because that's what I had on hand. Which from what I've seen is a pretty common substitution. Atleast in my home ;)
Decreased the flour by 2 Tbsp.

Great dumplings just like Mom used to make. The only thing I change is I substitute butter for the shortening but other than that it is perfect and super simple. The only problem with these dumplings is I always have to double or triple the recipe cause my guys can't get enough of them.

I have tried and tried to make good dumplings, like my mom made when I was a child. I have never been able to do it. This recipe is awesome!
I did sift all of the dry ingredients, before mixing the rest of it. I also added some parsley, just before they were done.
Perfect!!Thank you!! Yum!

I'm giving this 5 stars for EASE! BUT.. I added a little garlic powder, lemon pepper and parsley to the dumpling mixture and it really kicked up their flavor!!
,
Good as a replacement for refrigerator biscuits in the cowboy casserole
This is as easy as any boxed mix. I used butter instead of shortening. they were great in my chicken and dumplings.
Mmmmm

Finally, the dumpling I remember my mother making! My dumplings were always lead balls. The secret I was missing is in this recipe. Shortening - not cold butter. Made my dumplings light and fluffy! Like Mom's I added about 1 teaspoon nutmeg. Ah, back to my childhood!
I cooked chicken yesterday and discovered I was out of Bisquick. I used this recipe and we loved it. My husband ate more for his breakfast this morning! I will hang onto this one! Thanks. MP

These were wonderful. I followed the recipe exactly and had to add a little more flour as the dough was very wet but the came out fluffy and perfect. I had baked a turkey and used the drippings plus a can of chicken broth and additional water. The best recipe I've found.

These dumplings were delicious! I used self rising flour, used butter instead of shortening, added finely shredded colby jack cheese, about 4 tbs, garlic powder and parsley flakes. I did not add any salt. Awesome on top of my lemon chicken stew!

I used butter instead of shortening (personal taste), but these dumplings are pure heaven. I cover the whole top of the roaster with them then brush them with rendered butter once the tops firm up. Thank you Zen K for sharing such a wonderful recipe!
Very good. I use this as my go-to recipe for dumplings. I do however, add an egg to help keep them together. Otherwise they tend to dissolve away in my chicken and dumplings.
Excellent, however, mom taught me to save a bundle of time and effort by following the directions for dumplings on the side of the bisquick box. This is exactly what you get.
I just made these for dinner, and what a winner!definitely making these as a staple for stews and soups very good!
too mushy
So good. These dumplings were just what my split pea needed.
Just what I was looking for. Perfect drop dumplings.

I used butter for the shortening and just a pinch of salt, followed the directions and ended up with exremely light melt in your mouth dumplings my family loved. Don't forget always eat your dumplings with a fork, if you cut into them with a spoon it flattens them and they lose that "aireness".

Love this recipe. I did change it up just a bit. I used kosher salt and whole buttermilk. I also dropped the dough by half teaspoon full. I lightly peppered the dumplins when done. They were wonderful. I will never use another dumplin recipe ever again.
Just like the ones my grandma used to make. Needed to add some pepper though.
giving this a 2star,I don't know but my dumplings were mushy! Ended up taking them out of the soup..Sorry but this is not the recipe for me. Followed the dumpling part the way explained.
Aptly named, yet so very good, this is definately a keeper. The family gorged themselves on my chicken and dumplings. I will try some in a stew next. Keep in mind that these will thicken your broth.
Very good - I was tryng to replace my mothers dumpling recipe I lost when our house burned down, this ws good but I added one egg and it was even more fluffly
Perfect! cooking time was perfect, followed exactly; did use the butter flavor crisco. whipped up in a split second. The finished product is so light and fluffy. this is a winner. thanks.
This made perfect dough! Thanks for posting!
These dumplings turn plain chicken soup into something DELICIOUS!

Very fast, easy, and delicious; a must-have for winter stews and soups! The only thing I changed was to use butter instead of shortening, and cut back the salt to 1/2 tsp since the butter I used was salted. My husband told me he would love it if I served these with every soup or stew we eat.

Used these in the Slow Cooker chicken and dumplings, I didn't want to use refrig biscuits. Added a little chopped fresh rosemary and made small balls which I elongated so they looked like little footballs. I think next time I will leave out the rosemary but these were very easy and good!

Great and simple recipe for quick dumplings.
I also added fresh parsley and it was good.
These are so easy and just wonderful on a cold winter evening.

This recipe is a keeper for me. I made it last night using butter and goats milk...then added it in globs into my Beef Veggie Soup covered it for about 20-30 min and it all was delicious. I was going to withhold the full amount of salt at first but I did add all the salt. A keeper. thanks for sharing.
Great recipe, used in a hurry and the dumplings taste great. will use this again.
I use this recipe all the time. My family loves it, and I don't change a thing.... Super fantastic, tastes like my Mom's from when I was a kid.......

Very good and easy to make. The second time I made them I added some herbs and formed them into balls with my hands instead of just spooning them in because I like dumplings a little denser. They were delicious.
Simple and delicious! Husband raved about them.
These dumplings are excellent, and I didn't change a thing.
I would have given these 3 stars, but I think it just comes down to personal preference. I like my dumplings a little denser, these were a little fluffier (dry) on the inside.

This is really good, but I use an easier way to make dumplings. I use Pillsbury biscuits that come 4 cans to the package. Just tear them into small pieces and drop them into the boiling liquid as you tear them. So easy and so good!
Love these, very simple and delicious!!

Made these for chicken and dumplings (as I didn't want to use biscuit mix like the chicken and dumpling recipe suggested), and these turned out extremely well. They're also really easy to make. I will definitely be keeping this around as the go-to dumpling recipe around here! They worked with that recipe, and would work well in pretty much any stew recipe you might want dumplings for.
This is the dumpling I remember as a kid. Thank you.

I sauteed carrots, celery, onions, garlic and a bay leaf together and then added some diced chicken breast. Thickened with cornstarch added salt and pepper to taste and then made these dumplings. They were great. They did not turn out as pictured but maybe my broth was more bubbly. Still they were chewy on the outside and bread like in the middle which is exactly how I want my dumplings. I did use butter instead of shortening. Thank you for the great recipe I will use over and over.
These turned out delicious.
SOOOOO easy and soooooo tasty. I have always bought the yellow box of biscuit mix to make dumplings. These are far better and the texture is less heavy.
Really good! I did mine in the slow cooker and I just need to remember to give it more time to cook through. But we were impatient and hungry! I also added parsley and basil to them. mmmmm.....

These dumplings tasted great and were extremely easy to make. I used them in my chicken stew last night and they came out so fluffy. I did follow the suggestions of the some other reviewers and used butter instead of shortening, added some black pepper as well as I cooked it covered on a low simmer for 20 minutes. My family really loved these and this will now be my new go to recipe for dumplings
These are so tender. Glad I now have a dumpling recipe that is so easy and tasty.
Followed the recipe. Very good. Was able to reheat the dumplings by very carefully removing them from cold soup, heating soup to a slow simmer and dropping dumplings back on top for about 10 minutes.
Delicious. I added a little bit of basil and garlic powder before adding the milk. Like the other reviewers said, "Just like Mom's"
These were really good dumplings, a bit too fluffy for my liking though, I like them a bit more dense.
Very good in turkey stew.
Its easy and very good, I used butter instead of shortening and added parsley.
